content:
SqlDataSourceFilteringEventHandler Delegate

Definition

Represents the method that will handle the Filtering event of the SqlDataSource control.

In this Article

public delegate void SqlDataSourceFilteringEventHandler(object sender, SqlDataSourceFilteringEventArgs e);
Inheritance
Object
System.Delegate
SqlDataSourceFilteringEventHandler

Remarks

Filtering is supported when the DataSourceMode property is set to the SqlDataSourceMode value.

When you create an SqlDataSourceFilteringEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see NIB: Consuming Events.
